question: Public service Broadcasting Day is observed to commemorate the visit of which national leader to the All India Radio?
explanation:
Public Service Broadcasting Day is observed every year on November 12th. This is to commemorate the visit of Mahatma Gandhi to the studio of All India Radio, Delhi in 1947.
Mahatma Gandhi addressed the displaced people, who had temporarily settled at Kurukshetra in Haryana after partition of India in 1947.
